name: Muslim Community Center Chicago

zakatClaimEvidence: The Muslim Community Center Chicago explicitly states: "The MCC Rehab and Welfare committee has been on the ground for the breadth of the COVID-19 pandemic, assisting families in need throughout the Chicagoland area. Our projects have ranged from delivering groceries and medicine to the elderly, overseeing zakat requests and distributions, and partnering with other organizations to assist people in need." Additionally, they have a dedicated "Rehab & Welfare/ Zakat Request" section on their website, mentioning "In person applications or Zakat distribution will only be every Thursday & Saturday: 11am -5 pm. Online applications will continue 7 days a week" and an "Online Zakat Form" where it states, "An application for zakat and/or sadaqa financial assistance does not guarantee that an applicant will receive zakat and/or sadaqa financial assistance. All applications are approved or denied at the sole discretion of The Muslim Community Center of Chicago." (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEsajlABBckk96DlDS8MykePGOK4EO-QkteQ4ngvJbFpQ7mmSxxR2jJ5XpoM-MO4rTVEGcgbwD875h3HiLzQWhksJlPcgkiKVUSiFroO34Eq1nmzG-OCTxrfuSMDj6CWed9)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $9,945,910, a program expense ratio of 93.4%, working capital of 23.6 months, and fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised.
The organization is registered as the Muslim Community Center Incorporate with associated financial metadata.
The organization maintains active community engagement and governance through formal voting processes for its Chicago-based operations.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and offers multiple donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates strong financial management and high spending on programs, though its overall score is moderated by a lack of external impact data and a medium donor alignment profile.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact verification for specific program outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: MCC shows a medium donor fit as it serves specific religious and cultural needs through marriage, funeral, and educational services [1][3]. Its long-standing presence in the community is evidenced by its active governance and voting processes [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through its full-time school and adult education programs, maintaining a high program expense ratio of 93.4% [1]. While it shows strong financial health with 23.6 months of working capital, specific cost-per-beneficiary data is not publicly available [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Community Center Incorporate serves as a vital religious and educational hub, providing comprehensive community services and a full-time school.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.4%, indicating most funds go directly to services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency at $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 23.6 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Center (MCC) provides a wide range of services including the teaching and recitation of the Holy Quran, daily congregations, and full-time schooling [1][3]. As a Zakat-eligible organization, it facilitates religious obligations through various donation methods to support its spiritual and educational programs [4].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-standing Islamic community institutions and want to ensure 93.4% of their contribution supports direct services and education.
donor_motivations: Want to support established Muslim community hubs in the US
Prioritize extremely low fundraising and administrative overhead
Seek to fulfill zakat through a multi-service religious center
giving_considerations: Donations support a wide range of services from schools to funerals
The organization holds very high cash reserves
Specific impact metrics per student or beneficiary are not publicly detailed
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-transparency organizations with rigorous third-party impact evaluations or those focused on international relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: While financial efficiency is perfect, there is <cite id="10">no formal tracking of long-term outcomes</cite> for students or community members.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MCC creates impact by providing the physical and spiritual infrastructure necessary for Islamic life and education in a minority context.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are effectively meeting the spiritual and academic needs of the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While revenue is growing at <cite id="14">17.8% annually</cite>, the high reserve levels suggest the organization has significant internal capacity.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="5">93.4% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="8">peer program ratio median of 81.7%</cite>.
With a <cite id="1">founding date in 1969</cite>, MCC has over 50 years of experience in <cite id="3">providing essential religious and social services</cite>.
The charity maintains <cite id="9">23.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer for long-term sustainability.

strengths_deep_dive: MCC's financial health is characterized by a lean operational model where <cite id="6">fundraising costs are kept at just $0.03 per $1 raised</cite>. This allows the organization to manage <cite id="2">nearly $10 million in annual revenue</cite> while ensuring that resources are concentrated on its <cite id="4">educational and religious infrastructure</cite>. Furthermore, the organization's role as a grantmaker, distributing over <cite id="7">$380,000 to partners like Medglobal and Helping Hand</cite>, demonstrates its capacity to support the broader humanitarian ecosystem while maintaining its local focus.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Center (MCC), <cite id="1">founded in 1969</cite>, serves as a cornerstone institution for the Muslim community in the Chicago area, providing a comprehensive suite of religious, educational, and social services. The organization reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $9,945,910</cite> in 2023, reflecting its significant scale as a regional hub. MCC's operations are diverse, encompassing <cite id="3">daily and Friday congregations, funeral and marriage services</cite>, and a library. A central pillar of their impact is the <cite id="4">full-time school and Quranic education programs</cite> for both children and adults. Financially, the organization demonstrates a high commitment to its core mission, maintaining a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 93.4%</cite> according to recent filings. This efficiency is further evidenced by a <cite id="6">fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that nearly every dollar donated is directed toward community services rather than administrative overhead. Beyond local services, MCC acts as a philanthropic conduit, distributing <cite id="7">$382,123 in domestic grants</cite> to various humanitarian partners.
